intro: Paranephelium fallax, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a unique member of the Blechnaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that resemble ghostly shapes, giving it its common name. The plant has a creeping rhizome that allows it to spread along the forest floor. Its leaves are typically light green and have a soft, velvety texture. Paranephelium fallax thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in temperate rainforests.
